page.title: 01DOWNS SOUTH OF EDINGTON
page.content: This area is bounded by north west facing scarp descending to Luccombe Bottom and 1/4 mile of the B3098 from Bratton to Edington.The grid line runs from here across the road,up Long Hollow,then climbs to edge of disused lime quarry ,crosses the old Bath to Sarum road,up Coulston Hill, through the west end of Coulston Wood and the escarpment.There it meets the east boundary and then runs up Stoke Hill, by abandoned Brounckers Farm to Brounckers Down.The southern end is bounded by Coulston Down and Tenantry Down. The grid crosses the Imber Road to join the western edge,south of derelict Thorncombe Farm and then passes just west of the farm, through Longcombe Bottom, up White Cliff to west of Imber Road through to Luccombe Mill pond and Bratton/Edington parish boundary to cross B3098 to the north.
